intro: Mapouria nettoana, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap, which is toxic and can cause skin irritation. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate or elliptical in shape. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its unique appearance and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
